meanings.definition: To turn or rotate around a central point.
meanings.sent1: She tried to twist the lid off the jar.
meanings.sent2: He likes to twist the handlebars while riding his bike.
meanings.sent3: The magician will twist the rope into a knot and then make it disappear!
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements twist and twirl gracefully on stage.
meanings.sent5: The wind caused the tree branches to twist and sway in the storm.

meanings.definition: A bend or curve in a shape or object.
meanings.sent1: The pretzel had a unique twist in its shape.
meanings.sent2: The road took a sharp twist around the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The twist in the wire made it difficult to unravel.
meanings.sent4: The twist in the river created a beautiful meander.
meanings.sent5: The twist in the plot of the movie kept the audience guessing.

meanings.definition: To distort or change the meaning of something.
meanings.sent1: He tried to twist her words to make himself look better.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid twisted the truth to sell more copies.
meanings.sent3: The comedian likes to twist jokes to make them funnier.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech twisted the facts to suit his agenda.
meanings.sent5: The artist's interpretation of the painting twisted its original meaning.

meanings.definition: A surprising or unexpected development in a story or situation.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a shocking twist at the end.
meanings.sent2: The plot twist in the book caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The twist in the tale made the story more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected twist in the game changed the outcome completely.
meanings.sent5: The twist in the mystery novel revealed the true culprit.
